page.title: 13MIDDLE SONTLEY
page.content: THE ROADS ARE NARROW WITH HEDGEROWS ON EACH SIDE. BEYOND THE HEDGEROWS ARE FIELDS OF CORN BELONGING TO THE FARMER. ON EACH SIDE OF THE ROAD ARE SCATTERED OAK AND ASH TREES WHICH ARE MAINLY COVERED WITH IVY. IN THE HEDGEROWS GREW NETTLES, BRAMBLES, DIFFERENT GRASSES AND WILD FLOWERS. UNDERNEATH ALL THIS THERE IS A DRAINAGE DITCH. TO THE SOUTH WE COULD SEE WAT'S DYKE. ON THE WAY TO OLD SONTLEY WE WALKED PAST A DAIRY FARM. AROUND THE FIELDS THERE IS AN ELECTRIC FENCE TO STOP THE COWS GETTING OUT. ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE OF THE ROAD THERE IS A 17TH CENTURY HOUSE WITH WELL KEPT GARDENS. ON THE WAY BACK MEN WERE MAKING SILAGE.
